03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/06_betweenarea_from_x_v2

Random variable \(C\) is normally distributed with mean \(\mu = 91\) and standard deviation \(\sigma = 5\). \[C = \text{N}(91,\,5) \] Evaluate \(P\left(89 < X < 91\right)\). In other words, what is the probability that \(C\) is between \(89\) and \(91\)?
